intro: Hieracium subcrassum, commonly known as the broad-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are broadly ovate with a rough texture, and its yellow flowers are arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Hieracium subcrassum is characterized by its hairy stems and is often found in sunny, open habitats.
